thread.title: Only in Brooklyn: Boutique Hotels Near a Contaminated Canal

author: Peter Grant
title: Only in Brooklyn: Boutique Hotels Near a Contaminated Canal
text:
Investor interest is growing in boutique hotels in New York’s outer boroughs that charge less than $100 per night while offering guests proximity to trendy attractions in emerging neighborhoods.
In the latest example, Red Pine Capital Partners is injecting new capital into two hotels in Brooklyn’s Gowanus neighborhood that values the properties at a total of $33.5 million, according to Michael Federman, Red Pine’s managing principal. New York-based Red Pine has about $350 million of real-estate assets under management throughout... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
